page.title: 18RELIGION IN CALLANDER
page.content: There are 3 denominations in Callander.Callander Kirk is the{Church {of Scotland }congregation.It was formed when St.Kessogs and St.Brides amalgamated on April 1st 1985.Of the 900 members only one third attend regularly. St.Joseph's is the{Roman Catholic {Church.}The present and first church was built in 1958.Of the 550 parishioners three quarters attend regularly.In summer the congregation is doubled and extra services are held to accommodate the visitors. St.Andrews,the{Episcolal Church}was founded in 1850 and is the oldest church in the town.There are 220 parishioners but only 30 attend regularly.The Rector of the church lives in Aberfoyle and he is responsible for the Episcopal churches in Callander,Doune,and Aberfoyle.
